thread.title: Halloween Happenings for week of Oct. 25, 2015
thread.title_full: Halloween Happenings for week of Oct. 25, 2015

author: Times-News
title: Halloween Happenings for week of Oct. 25, 2015
text: Posted Oct. 25, 2015 at 12:01 AM By Times-News Posted Oct. 25, 2015 at 12:01 AM Editor’s note: Halloween Happenings is for haunted/entertainment events only in Alamance County, the Piedmont-Triad and throughout the state of North Carolina. It will be published now through Halloween in the Accent section, as space allows. For more details or to submit events, email capple@thetimesnews.com or call (336) 506-3057. Haunted forest hayride, beginning at dark on Friday and Saturday nights through month of October, J. Razz Ma Tazz Farm, 466 Peeden Drive, Gibsonville. $12 for haunted forest. www.jrazz.com . 26th annual Original Hollywood Horror Show, 6333 Bass Mountain Road, Snow Camp. Hours are 8 p.m. to 11 p.m. Sundays through Thursdays and 8 p.m. to midnight Fridays and Saturdays. Dates are today through Saturday and Nov. 6-7. $20. www.hollywoodhor rorshow.com or visit them on Facebook, Twitter or Instagram. Scarowinds, 14523 Carowinds Blvd, Charlotte. Hours are 7 p.m. to midnight today and Friday and 7 p.m. to 1 a.m. Saturday. Tickets range from $33.99 and up. www.carow inds.com/haunt or visit them on Facebook, Twitter or Instagram. Zombie Scarefest, 6 p.m. to 11 p.m. today through Oct. 31, former Western Electric Plant, 204 N. Graham-Hopedale Road, Burlington. $20. zombiescaref est.com/ , www.facebook.com/zombiescarefest or (410) 533-1604 Woods of Terror, 5601 N. Church St., Greensboro. today and Thursday through Saturday and Nov. 1, 6 and 7. Gates open at 6 p.m., ticket booth opens at 6:30 p.m. and show starts at 7 p.m. Ticket booth closes at 9:30 p.m. Sundays through Thursday; 11:30 p.m. Fridays and Saturdays and Nov. 1, 6 and 7. $18 and up. woodsofter ror.com or (336) 286-9396. Haunted Forest Reborn, 153 Darrell Davis Road, Burlington. Hours are 7:30 p.m. to 11 p.m. Friday and Saturday. Cash only; $12 for adults and $5 for children 6 to 10 years old. www.rdellingerfreeservers.com or (336) 266-5109. Haunted Theater, Liberty Showcase Theater, 101 S. Fayetteville St., Liberty. Dates are Wednesday, Thursday and Saturday. Call (336) 622-3844 for advance tickets and information. 43rd annual Hawfields Civitan Haunted Forest, 2115-B Hwy. 119 South, Mebane. Hours are 7:30 p.m. to 10 p.m. Thursday, 11 p.m. Friday and 7 p.m. to 11 p.m. Saturday. $10. An annual fundraiser for the international award-winning Hawfields Civitan Club and Hawfields Junior Civitan Club. www.hchauntedforest.com . Hawfields Civitan’s No Scare, 2 p.m. to 4 p.m. Saturday, 2115-B Hwy. 119 South, Mebane. For ages up to 12 years old. $2. A fundraiser for the Hawfields Civitan Club and Hawfields Junior Civitan Club. www.hchauntedforest.com Page 2 of 2 - Haunted Train, City Park, 1333 Overbrook Road, Burlington. A Halloween twist on the train ride; this year’s event is Thursday through Saturday. The train will leave the station at 6:30 p.m. each night. $5. This is a fundraiser for Alamance Arts and is in conjunction with the Burlington Recreation & Parks Department. (336) 226-4495. House of Spirits, 7 p.m. to 10 p.m. Thursday, 7 p.m. to midnight Friday and 7 p.m.-until Saturday. Freedom Fellowship Church, 522 Trollinger St., Burlington. (336) 261-9801 or (336) 222-1778. High Point Community Theatre presents “The Addams Family,” 7:30 p.m. Thursday and Friday, 10 p.m. Saturday and 2 p.m. Sunday, High Point Theatre, 220 E. Commerce Ave., High Point. $38 and up. www.highpointtheatre.com or (336) 887-3001. Downtown Halloween Spooktacular, 3 p.m. to 5 p.m. Friday in downtown Burlington. Costume parade throughout downtown Burlington at 3 p.m., trick-or-treating and live entertainment. (336) 222-5030 or btowneventsnc.com or visit Btown Events on Facebook, Twitter and Instagram. Halloween Movies On The Lawn, Slade Park, 404 Ball Park Ave., Elon. “Monsters, Inc.” begins at 6:30 p.m. Friday. Free. (336) 449-9255. “Murder at the Masquerade,” a murder-mystery dinner, Friday, The Cutting Board, 2699 Ramada Road, Burlington. Doors open at 6:30 p.m. and the show begins at 7 p.m. Buffet dinner and cash bar available. $50 for individuals and $375 for a table of eight. (336) 229-2770. “Death After Death,” a murder-mystery evening, 7 p.m. Friday, The Event Center at Extraordinary Ventures, 200 S. Elliott Road, Chapel Hill. Suggested donation of $60 which will benefit the mission of Extraordinary Ventures (includes three-course meal, glass of wine and a show). (919) 967-1100, ext. 104 or visit www.eventsevnc.org . Dark In The Park Halloween Celebration, City Park, 1333 Overbrook Road, Burlington. This year’s event is from 5 p.m. to 9 p.m. Saturday. Halloween-themed games and the annual fireworks show at 8 p.m. (336) 222-5030 or btowneventsnc.com or visit Btown Events on Facebook, Twitter and Instagram. Clover Court Chaos, 7 p.m. to 9 p.m. Saturday, 518 Clover Court in the Brassfield Meadows subdivision, Burlington. Located off Lakeside/Old Glencoe Road. Free. ktg99@triad.rr.com. Halloween Daze and Spooky Nights, 10 a.m. to 5:30 p.m. Saturday and Nov. 1, Carolina Renaissance Festival, 16445 Poplar Tent Road, Hillsborough. Children ages 5 through 12 will be admitted for free (courtesy of Harris Teeter). Adult tickets are $23 when purchased in advance at Harris Teeter stores ($1 higher at the gate). Event parking is free. (704) 896-5544 or (877) 896-5544 or carolina.renfestinfo.com . By Times-News
